Greg Werkheiser, candidate for the House of Delegates from the 42nd District in southern Fairfax County, has raised

ldc_scope.charseq: Greg Werkheiser, candidate for the House of Delegates from the 42nd District in southern Fairfax County, has raised significantly more money to date than his incumbent opponent, David Albo, and leads all challengers statewide in fundraising, according to reports filed with the State Board of Elections on January 18, 2005
Werkheiser's contributions come from 200 individuals; Albo had 8 individual contributors

extent.charseq: Greg Werkheiser, candidate for the House of Delegates from the 42nd District in southern Fairfax County, has raised significantly more money to date than his incumbent opponent, David Albo, and leads all challengers statewide in fundraising

extent.charseq: Werkheiser leads all challengers statewide in total contributions

ldc_scope.charseq: Werkheiser leads all challengers statewide in total contributions raised and funds on-hand

extent.charseq: Werkheiser out-raised his opponent by almost 2 to 1: Werkheiser $81,615; Albo $55,119

extent.charseq: Governor Mark Warner won the district with similar margins in 2001

ldc_scope.charseq: Nearly fifty-two percent of the district voted for John Kerry in 2004, and Governor Mark Warner won the district with similar margins in 2001
